Hi,

If you are new to Java you should perhaps start by reading up on JDBC for
the communications with the database.

As for the rest, the Developer's Manual for Heritrix has excellent
information about how to write your own Processor:
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual/ar01s11.html

No modifications to Heritrix's code base will be required! New processors
plug in pretty easily. 

- Kris

> -----Original Message-----
> From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
> [mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Joshi Sudhindra
> Sent: 13. september 2006 05:47
> To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [archive-crawler] Inserting information to MYSQL during crawl
> 
> Hello,
> I was told to write a processor in heritrix so that it should 
> take url and string as input and process the crawling if page 
> contains the given string then that link should be written to 
> mysql.Can anybody help me in this regard?
> 
> I am new to java. I donn't khow where to modify the heritrix 
> code and configure the same in heritrix.
> 
> I don't want to store the content .i just want to store the 
> matched link.
> 
> Thanks in advance
> Sudhindra Joshi
>
